info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Cumberland and western Prince Edward Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 745 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Darlington Heights, or 8 miles north of Charlotte Court House, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Hampden Sydney College around 800 PM EDT. Hampden Sydney around 805 PM EDT. Prospect around 810 PM EDT. Farmville around 820 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Kingsville, Raines Tavern, Briery Creek Lake, Tuggle, Elam, Reeds, Allens Mill and Worsham. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
